chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of both charges. Because Wisconsin law provides for only one penalty even if there is a conviction on both, no additional penalty has been imposed as a result of the second charge.

  • Jason M Carson was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jason M Carson was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).
  • Jason M Carson was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Jason M Carson was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
